Params: With a puff of smoke, a fleet of gaudy "vehicles" stops before Cerberus.
The truth is Vera cannot really decide if these are "vehicles" at all. Some of them look like fortresses, some bald sea urchins, and some watermelons with toothpicks all over them.
The only thing they have in common is they all have wheels.
What are these people doing here? Talent shows?
Tch. Your decorations are so tacky...
Someone who appears to be the leader of this gang walks off the "toothpicked watermelon," standing in front of a ground of strange-looking goons.
Who the hell is this? Did you hire some clowns to entertain me again, Noctis?
Would I have such terrible taste?
Hey! My design was awarded in the last event the Task Force held!
You mean the grenade that looks like No. 21?
A grenade looking like me... Noctis?
Yeah, the grenade without a safety pin. I think someone from WGAA... Leo-whatshername was making it, right?
Even ignoring how it looks, its explosive capability is definitely a blast—
A bullet follows the rifling and flies toward the sky. In this empty field, it does not cause any reverberation.
His angry cry—mixed with a hint of humiliation—sounds similarly insipid in the wilderness.
What is it now? Do you provide entertainment on top of car repairs?
Not only did you not pay, but you also broke what belonged to me.
Huh? What did we do this time?
The garage owner points at the scraps that still carry a minor dose of the Punishing Virus in the trunk of Cerberus' car.
You do have pretty terrible taste. You're even worse than 21.
You told us to take care of these Corrupted in exchange for fixing our car. Wasn't that the deal?
****! You were lucky you didn't die!
You have two options now! Your money or your lives!
The owner waves his hand, and a group of Constructs in strange attire jumps out of the caravan behind him. There are even a few cars filled with the Corrupted, whose eyes are glowing red.
Since you haven't heard of Cerberus...
Vera points her banner spear at the enemies provocatively.
Let us give you a few pointers.
